cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.DB, cs.CL, cs.LG. 

The paper addresses the problem of author name disambiguation, which is a common issue in information retrieval (IR) and digital libraries (DL). The use of probabilistic similarity measures and feature overlap suggests a focus on machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP), which are subfields of IR and DL. The evaluation of the approach using researcher-ID data suggests a focus on databases (DB) and data mining (DM). The mention of clustering also suggests a focus on clustering algorithms, which are commonly used in machine learning and data analysis. Finally, the use of relative frequencies suggests a focus on statistical methods, which are commonly used in machine learning and data analysis. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.DB, cs.CL, and cs.LG.
